subject: A Few Lessons By Warren Buffet
credit: A Few Lessons By Warren Buffet

todos.title: Matthew 6
todos.body: 21  For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

todos.title: Trade
todos.body: What you are giving is just as important as what you are getting.

todos.title: Fear
todos.body: We make some of our best purchases when people fear.  Fear is the foe of the faddist but the friend of the fundamentalist.

todos.title: Reputation
todos.body: We can afford to lose all our money but we cannot afford to lose our reputation.

todos.title: Difficult Business Problems
todos.body: Try to avoid them, not solve them.

todos.title: Decentralization
todos.body: Trust and give your managers the authority to make decisions.

todos.title: Networking Effect
todos.body: The product or service becomes more valuable to customer when there are more user (social media, advertising).

todos.title: Focus v. Diversification
todos.body: Tend to go in and out of style.

todos.title: Debrief
todos.body: Study your mistakes, not your successes.

todos.title: Trust
todos.body: Stick to proven management with integrity, talent, and passion.

todos.title: Audit
todos.body: Spend time looking into the numbers.  Always keep two sets of books.

todos.title: Patience
todos.body: Some things take time, you can have a baby in nine months by getting one woman pregnant but you can't have a baby in nine months by getting none women pregnant.

todos.title: Leaky Boat
todos.body: Should you find yourself in a leaky boat sometimes it is better to spend the energy to find a new boat rather than fixing all the holes.  No problem is too big to run away from.

todos.title: Change
todos.body: Severe change and exceptional returns don't go well except for the few very lucky.

todos.title: Gruesome Businesses
todos.body: Requires a lot of capital for a small or no sales growth.  Usually products that are not lowest in price or don't have strong brand recognition.

todos.title: Brand
todos.body: Reputation for quality.

todos.title: All or Nothing (Devon)
todos.body: Remember that in business, two out of three is bad, often times you need to meet all three elements of success in order to be successful.  This does not mean try to be everything to everyone.

todos.title: Polonius
todos.body: Neither a short term borrower nor long term lender be.

todos.title: Eat Our Own Cooking
todos.body: Most of our directors have skin in the game.

todos.title: BNSF Success
todos.body: Monopoly on tracks and railroads are three times more fuel efficient than trucks.

todos.title: Don't Make The Numbers
todos.body: Managers that promise to make the numbers will eventually start to make up the numbers.

todos.title: Float
todos.body: Making money of the interest when clients prepay (insurance).

todos.title: Computer Chimera
todos.body: Machines can compliment man but never trust or rely on them for precision or they will institute a false sense of security.

todos.title: Ignore Resumes
todos.body: Look for passion, brains, and integrity.

todos.title: Capital to Sales (Cost of Capital)
todos.body: Look at the ratio of a companies capital investment to annual sales growth.  If it takes $4 of capital to produce $1 of additional sales your cost of capital is 25%.

todos.title: Size
todos.body: Limit your team's size or you will become slow thinking, resistant to change and smug.  'We shape our buildings and then our buildings shape us.' (Churchill)

todos.title: Simple
todos.body: Keep it plain and simple.

todos.title: Cash
todos.body: Keep cash around.  If you want to shoot a rare big fast moving elephant you better have a loaded gun.

todos.title: Reporting
todos.body: Just tell me the bad news.  The good news will take care of itself.

todos.title: Cash Source
todos.body: It doesn't matter where cash comes from it all spends the same.

todos.title: Intelligent Investor
todos.body: Investment is most intelligent when it is business like.

todos.title: Intrinsic Value v. Book Value
todos.body: Intrinsic value is what something is worth and book value is the price it was sold for.  Book value is a meaningless indicator of intrinsic value.

todos.title: David Oglivy
todos.body: If each of us hires people smaller than we are we shall become a company of dwarves, if each of us hires people bigger than us we shall be a company of giants.

todos.title: Universal Business Formula
todos.body: How much does your capital produce.

todos.title: Two Sided Balance Sheets
todos.body: Honest businesses make money by maintaining the highest possible return on assets and the lowest cost on liabilities.

todos.title: Great Business
todos.body: High returns, sustainable competitive advantage, and barriers to entry.

todos.title: Return on Capital
todos.body: Has three parts  1. Sales units and price, 2. Operating Costs to make product and provide service and experience, 3. Invested capital to conduct business.

todos.title: Activity v. Accomplishment
todos.body: Don't confuse activity with accomplishment.  What do the key metrics say.

todos.title: Conflict of Interest
todos.body: Don't ask the barber when you need a haircut.

todos.title: Culture
todos.body: Culture more than rule books determines how a business behaves.

todos.title: Cigar Butt
todos.body: Buying a shitty business at a really low cost.  There may be one or two more puffs to get out of it but eventually it will fail.

todos.title: Headwinds
todos.body: Businesses are performing worse than they should because of external conditions.

todos.title: Tailwinds
todos.body: Business performs better than it should because of external conditions (such as lousy completion).

todos.title: Parallel Options
todos.body: Build multiple options in parallel so that you can compare them and chose the best one without losing time.

todos.title: Moats
todos.body: Barriers to entry.  Ask yourself how you would like to compete with the industry.  Sometimes being a bit aggressive encourages others not to compete.  Moats can be established by being lowest cost (price) or having brand that people ask for (quality - 'I'll have a Coke.').

todos.title: Timing
todos.body: A man went to a vet and said, sometimes my horse limps and sometimes he walks just fine, what should I do.  The vet said, wait until he walks fine and sell him.

todos.title: Nebraska Furniture Mart/Borsheim's Success
todos.body: 1. Unmatched depth and bredth of merchandise found in one location (like Walmart), 2. Lowest operating cost/highest margins, 3. Shrewd buying made possible by high volume purchasing, 4. Incredible service.

todos.title: Tough Businesses
todos.body: 1. Businesses where you have to be smart and on top of trends every day (retail, hospitality), 2. Fast changing businesses where it is tough to judge future competitive advantage (technology).

todos.title: What Berkshire Looks For
todos.body: 1. Business you can understand, 2. Favorable economics, 3. Trustworthy management, 4. Sensible price tag.

todos.title: Flooded Markets
todos.body: What wise men do in the beginning fools do in the end.

todos.title: Commodity/Brand Strength Test
todos.body: To know if a business is a commodity listen to whether people ask for a product type or a brand name ('I'll have a Coke').

todos.title: Strategic Plan Woes
todos.body: Often times having a strategic plan can cause you to make poor decisions and overpay.  By not having a strategic plan you don't have t proceed in one direction but can make decisions based on the interests of capital.

todos.title: Don't Add Without Subtracting
todos.body: Nothing forever, everything needs updating, replaced, or improved to be worthwile.  When people add value, make sure they are also subtracting depreciation.

todos.title: Winner Takes All
todos.body: In certain industries that often include networking effect the winner usually takes all (newspapers, Facebook).

todos.title: Commodity
todos.body: In a business selling a commodity product it is impossible to be ten times smarter, or better then the competitor.  The only thing you can be is more efficient and cheaper.

todos.title: Code of Ethics
todos.body: Develop a code of ethics.

todos.title: Conflict
todos.body: Be careful working with people who have irons in many fires.
